response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, and 1 tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl whisk 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla until smooth. Add 1 cup boiling water, stirring until combined. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, beating on medium speed for 2 minutes until batter is silky.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare frosting: beat ½ cup softened butter until fluffy. Gradually add 3 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until light and spreadable, adding more milk if needed for desired consistency.",
  "step5": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a generous layer of frosting over the top. Place the second layer on top, then apply a thin crumb coat all around the cake. Chill for 15 minutes to set the crumb coat before the final frosting layer.",
  "step6": "Finish by frosting the sides and top of the cake with the remaining frosting. Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles if desired. Slice, serve, and enjoy a moist, rich chocolate cake perfect for 8 guests."
}
